suite.name: Registration

kw.name: Begin Web Test
kw.doc: Operations that are repeated at test suite level setup

kw.name: Convert Suite Variables To Correct Types
kw.doc: This keyword is needed because parameters passed by command line to robot (i.e. -v variable_name:value) are of string types We need to convert: - DATA_SET_LENGTH to int (i.e. integer) - USE_EXISTING_FORM_DATA_SET to bool (i.e. boolean) Later these values will be used upon loading RegistrationFormDataReader.py as a custom Library.

kw.doc: Evaluates the given expression in Python and returns the result.

kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Import Resource
kw.doc: Imports a resource file with the given path.

kw.name: Load Locator Resources
kw.doc: Depending on the BROWSER selected, it loads the corresponding locator resource files This keyword enables us to choose the right folder (e.g. Locators/Chromium), inside which we expect to have the correct *Locators.resource files. Each *Locators.resource file (e.g. Locators/Chromium/LoginPageLocators.resource) contains the correct locators for the page in question (e.g. Login Page) and for the browser (e.g. Chromium ) in question

kw.name: List Files In Directory
kw.doc: Wrapper for `List Directory` that returns only files.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Get Attribute Names
kw.doc: Returns all HTML attribute names of an element as a list.

kw.name: Get Element Count
kw.doc: Returns the count of elements found with ``selector``.

kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

Last names must be seperated by a a single space. Last names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'phone_number': {'value': '', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Please fill out this field.'}}

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.doc: Returns from the enclosing user keyword.

kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.arg: 'Could not calculate next page from registration form data'

Last names must be seperated by a a single space. Last names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'phone_number': {'value': '0+506662712+', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'phone number can only contain numbers [0-9] and optionally a single plus sign at the beginning indicating the country code'}}

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.arg: 'Could not calculate next page from registration form data'

First names must be seperated by a a single space. First names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'last_name': {'value': 'Cuzdan123!?.', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Each last name must contain only characters from the set [a-zA-Z]. Last names must be seperated by a a single space. Last names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'phone_number': {'value': '+358506662712', 'isValid': True}}

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Return From Keyword
kw.doc: Returns from the enclosing user keyword.

kw.name: Get Attribute Names
kw.doc: Returns all HTML attribute names of an element as a list.

kw.name: Get Element Count
kw.doc: Returns the count of elements found with ``selector``.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Return From Keyword
kw.doc: Returns from the enclosing user keyword.

kw.name: Get Attribute Names
kw.doc: Returns all HTML attribute names of an element as a list.

kw.name: Get Element Count
kw.doc: Returns the count of elements found with ``selector``.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Fail
kw.arg: 'Could not calculate next page from registration form data'
kw.doc: Fails the test with the given message and optionally alters its tags.

Last names must be seperated by a a single space. Last names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'phone_number': {'value': '+358506662712', 'isValid': True}}

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

Space character is not allowed'}, 'password': {'value': 'ABC!?.01', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Min 8 characters. Must contain at least one character from [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [!?.]'}, 'first_name': {'value': 'H Xu', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Each first name must contain only characters from the set [a-zA-Z]. First names must be seperated by a a single space. First names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'last_name': {'value': 'W Xi', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Each last name must contain only characters from the set [a-zA-Z]. Last names must be seperated by a a single space. Last names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'phone_number': {'value': '+358506abc!#662712', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'phone number can only contain numbers [0-9] and optionally a single plus sign at the beginning indicating the country code'}}

We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Fail
kw.arg: 'Could not calculate next page from registration form data'
kw.doc: Fails the test with the given message and optionally alters its tags.

kw.name: Log
kw.arg: Registration (with index: ${index}) succeeded with the following form data
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Log
kw.arg: Registration (with index: ${index}) has failed with the following form data
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.
kw.msg: Registration (with index: 76) has failed with the following form data

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.
kw.msg: {'username': {'value': '12345678 12345', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Minimum 8 characters required. Space character is not allowed'}, 'password': {'value': '!?.?!.!?', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Min 8 characters. Must contain at least one character from [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [!?.]'}, 'first_name': {'value': 'Hakan123!?.', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Each first name must contain only characters from the set [a-zA-Z]. First names must be seperated by a a single space. First names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'last_name': {'value': 'Holm123', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Each last name must contain only characters from the set [a-zA-Z]. Last names must be seperated by a a single space. Last names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'phone_number': {'value': '+358+50666+2712', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'phone number can only contain numbers [0-9] and optionally a single plus sign at the beginning indicating the country code'}}

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.doc: Returns all HTML attribute names of an element as a list.

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.

kw.name: Fail
kw.arg: 'Could not calculate next page from registration form data'
kw.doc: Fails the test with the given message and optionally alters its tags.

Must contain at least one character from [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [!?.]'}, 'first_name': {'value': 'H Xu', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'Each first name must contain only characters from the set [a-zA-Z]. First names must be seperated by a a single space. First names must have at least 2 characters'}, 'last_name': {'value': 'Cuzdan', 'isValid': True}, 'phone_number': {'value': '050!?.#662712', 'isValid': False, 'expected_error': 'phone number can only contain numbers [0-9] and optionally a single plus sign at the beginning indicating the country code'}}

kw.name: Check Registration Form Error Messages
kw.doc: Before this keyword is called, the form is filled with registration_form_data and Register button is clicked. registration_form_data is a dictionary containing 5 (UI) elements: - username - password - first_name - last_name - phone_number Refer to TestData/RegisterFormDataSet.json for a list of registration_form_data examples. We check in the above given priority order the following: - If the element (e.g. username) is invalid, then we expect to see its custom error message - If the custom error message is shown, then we move on to the next element. - Otherwise, we fail with telling which custom error message is missing.
